alert.note: Alert for Richland (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 23 at 6:04PM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM CDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast North Dakota, including the following county, Richland. * WHEN...Until 100 AM CDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 603 PM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Over 3 inches of rain have been reported in portions of Richland county, with some spots over 4 inches. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hankinson, Wyndmere, Mantador, Barney and Barrie.
info.instruction: Safety message - Turn around, don`t drown. Don`t travel through flooded areas. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
